header.title: The Scroll of Set, Volume XVI-2, Issue 109
header.category: Western Esotericism, Occultism, Setianism, Depth Psychology, Consciousness Studies

central_thesis: The core thesis is that Setian philosophy, as a non-natural, Left-Hand Path religion, is dedicated to the cultivation of the individual's isolate intelligence (the Self) to achieve Xeper (individually-determined freedom and becoming). This process involves a deep understanding and conscious development of one's psyche, utilizing both esoteric psychological models (like Jungian archetypes) and advanced technological methods (like hemispheric synchronization) to alter and master consciousness for effective magical practice, thereby transcending conventional 'natural' or RHP limitations.

structure_content.chapter_title: [1] Setian Philosophy: Natural vs. Non-Natural Religion
structure_content.summary: This foundational article distinguishes between natural religions (which subordinate the self to external forces like God or Nature) and non-natural religions (which cultivate isolate intelligence within the individual for self-determined freedom). Setian philosophy is presented as a sophisticated non-natural system focused on Xeper, rejecting the RHP's dissolution of the self while embracing the individual's unique intelligence.

This workshop introduces Jungian psychology as a vital tool for Black Magicians. It defines key concepts such as the psyche (totality of psychological processes), ego, soul (anima/animus), intellect, spirit, and persona. The article details the four functions of consciousness (thinking, feeling, intuition, sensation) and explains how understanding these elements aids in personal transfiguration and conscious magical practice, preventing self-deception like projection.

This section describes a practical workshop on using binaural beats for hemispheric synchronization ('hemi-sync') to induce altered states of consciousness, specifically Theta waves, which are conducive to magical work. It explains the mechanics of how binaural beats fool the brain into synchronizing hemispheres and generating specific brainwave frequencies, presenting it as a powerful tool for conscious control over one's mental state, accessible without extensive training.

This manifesto articulates the core tenets of Setianism, emphasizing authentic individualism, the rejection of external worship, and the necessity of creating a personal code of ethics distinct from profane society. It champions the 'Black Flame' as the source of individual power and the pursuit of Xeper, positioning the Temple of Set as an elite society of the Elect within society but not of it.

This article discusses the Temple of Set's role in actively countering anti-Satanic hysteria and misinformation, highlighting its efforts in educating the public and law enforcement about authentic Satanism. It contrasts these effective actions with the perceived lack of engagement from other groups, asserting the Temple's leadership in defending genuine esoteric practice and promoting Setian ideals internationally.

key_concepts.definition: Systems of belief or practice that arise from and are limited by the regularly-occurring organic or mechanical processes of the objective universe, typically subordinating the individual self to external forces like God or Nature.

A philosophical or religious system, such as Setianism, that focuses on cultivating and nurturing the principle of isolate intelligence within the Universe, which manifests in individual humans, to achieve self-determined freedom (Xeper).

The Setian concept of 'becoming' or 'self-creation.' It represents the process of cultivating one's isolate intelligence to achieve individually-determined freedom, self-mastery, and personal evolution, distinct from RHP notions of union or dissolution.
The innate Gift of Intelligence present within individual members of the human species, serving as the source of their power and potential for Xeper. It is to be cultivated and glorified.
Jung's definition of the totality of psychological and mental processes within an individual, comprising both unconscious and conscious spheres. It encompasses the ego, soul, intellect, and spirit.

A part of the ego that mediates between the individual and the external world. It functions as a supple, protective covering, adapting the individual's 'wish image' to the demands of society and personal limitations, and is considered a crucial tool for Left-Hand Path work when consciously utilized.

Jung's model categorizing the four basic ways consciousness operates: Thinking (rational, conscious, logical), Feeling (rational, unconscious, judging pleasantness/unpleasantness), Sensation (irrational, perceives things as they are), and Intuition (irrational, unconscious inner perception of inherent potential). These functions exist in antithetical pairs (Thinking/Feeling, Sensation/Intuition).

A technique, often involving binaural beats, used to encourage both hemispheres of the brain to operate in unison, leading to induced altered states of consciousness (e.g., Theta waves for meditative states) for specific magical or developmental purposes.

An auditory phenomenon where the brain perceives a 'beat' frequency when two slightly different pure tones are presented separately to each ear. This perceived beat causes the brain to synchronize its electrical activity at that difference frequency, thereby inducing specific brainwave states (e.g., Delta, Theta, Alpha, Beta).

practical_system.description: The practical system is centered on the conscious cultivation of isolate intelligence (the Self) for Xeper. This involves introspective psychological work using Jungian concepts to understand and integrate the psyche's components (ego, soul, intellect, spirit, persona) and functions of consciousness. Operatively, it incorporates techniques for altering consciousness, primarily through binaural beat technology (hemi-sync), to achieve desired brainwave states (e.g., Theta for meditation/divination) for magical workings. The system also implies a framework for creating personal ethics and engaging with profane society strategically, using one's developed consciousness as a tool.
tools: Jungian psychological models (psyche, ego, persona, functions of consciousness).
Tarot cards, specifically for correlating psychological concepts (soul/Cups, intellect/Swords, spirit/Wands, psyche/Discs).
Binaural beat generators and stereo headphones/speakers for hemispheric synchronization.
Research into esoteric lore and philosophy to deepen understanding of magical paths.
rituals: Personal workings before the altar, incorporating hypnotic induction facilitated by hemi-sync tones.
Introspective psychological self-analysis, viewing it as 'personal transfiguration' akin to alchemy.
Destruction rituals, with a strong emphasis on understanding psychological projection to ensure efficacy and avoid 'backfiring' (targeting one's own projected faults).
The 'Mass of Haborym' (a ritualistic poem invoking spiritual entities and elements like 'Khat', 'Khu', 'Ka', 'chalice', 'water', 'wine', 'sword').

relevant_quotes.text: The LHP solution is then to cultivate and nurture this intelligence as a separate and unique quality, that it may Xeper. Xeper leads to individually-determined freedom.

The philosophy of the Temple of Set is not a natural religion; it is essentially a non-natural one. It is perhaps the most sophisticated and self-conscious exponent of this point of view that history has yet seen.

The alchemist's true goal was not the transmutation of chemicals but personal transfiguration. He/she was “both the vessel of his work and the material in it” (Cavendish, The Black Arts). The alchemist used a series of "chemical" conversions and experiments to symbolize the changes he/she wished to instill in his/her own psyche.
The persona should be able to adjust instantly to any situation and environment, and it is probably the single most important tool of any LBM work.
Worship, however, has no place in the Setian's relationship to Set. This is an essential aspect of the Setian religion.
The Gift of Set and its utilization by individual consciousness remain the last true bastion against the forces of coercion and collectivization that control profane society.
The hemi-sync method we investigated in this workshop involved putting different tones into each ear (binaural/stereo stimuli) to fool the brain into putting them together.

critical_analysis.relevance: This collection of articles is highly relevant for understanding the foundational philosophy and practical methodologies of the Temple of Set in the late 20th century. It rigorously defines Setianism as a distinct non-natural Left-Hand Path, emphasizing individual evolution and conscious self-mastery (Xeper). The integration of Jungian psychology provides a sophisticated framework for internal magical work, while the exploration of hemispheric synchronization introduces a cutting-edge technological approach to altering consciousness for magical purposes. The pieces collectively showcase a system that values intellectual rigor and practical application in esoteric development, positioning Setianism as a proactive force in shaping its public image and dispelling misinformation.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience includes initiates and advanced practitioners of the Temple of Set seeking to deepen their understanding of Setian philosophy and practical magic. Additionally, researchers and serious students of Western Esotericism, Left-Hand Path traditions, modern occultism, and the psychology of magic would find valuable insights into the theoretical underpinnings and operative techniques of Setianism.
